title: Lore-Wise is Galio stronger than Nasus/Renekton?
body: Obviously bard and Aurelian Sol are the strongest characters lore wise now, but I was wondering how Galio stacks up to what used to be the strongest champions lore wise, Nasus and Renekton.

replies.body:
...debatably? I mean Galio is matched to some degree by Sion, who wasn't always the undead behemoth he is now, implying that even a non-magical human could give Galio a rough time. 

If Sion's anything to go by, then I'd say the Ascended would be able to match Galio, especially since Bloodline confirmed that the brother's ability to grow in size is very much canon.
What about Xerath? Since he is almost completely about magic.

I'd say it depends on how petricite (petricide?) Interacts with magic to begin with. Galio says he absorbs magic, which then begs the question of what the stone does after it's absorbed the magic. Honestly I dunno.
Petricite. That name will make more sense once the bio is released!
Is the stone literally petrified magic?

Maybe by absorbing magic it converts the energies consumed in to more of itself, making it a self perpetuating material of effectively petrified magic. That'd be cool.

That'd be pretty cool for Galio as well because it would mean in the pressence of magic his body would restore itself to mitigate the effects of weather and time wearing him down.
So basically if Xerath were to touch him Demacia would be buried in stone.  I like this non cannon lore.
Explains the higher resistance with more MR and the regenerating magic damage shield if nothing else.
Got it. Thanks!
Whatever the material is it cannot absorb things indefinetly and Xerath magic power seems more than enough to overheat Galio's Petricite.
Like I said, depends on how it's made and where it comes from. For now, I'm not going to underestimate petricite, though I would be surprised if it could handle Xerath.

I'd say Kindred is stronger than Bard

Using D&D logic (which may not apply here), it seems reasonable to me that he is not.  While undead are created and animated through magic, that magic is not essential to their continued existence.  Mordenkainen's Disjunction is key to knowing this: it seems to have no effect on them.

In a similar way, I'd predict that the magic that ascended Nasus and Renekton is not susceptible to petricite, but were they to grow in size or use similar magic Galio would be empowered.  So if they were to fight without use of magic (and as someone else mentioned, Renekton probably would anyway) they'd probably be able to overpower Galio.  But at that point Demacia's army would probably be able to back him up.  On the other hand, if they used magic, Galio would probably be the winner.
